generalInfo: Cefadroxil is excreted in breast milk in small amounts; can be used.

pregnancy.specificInfo: Generally considered safe in pregnancy when prescribed appropriately.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Dose adjustment required in renal impairment; reduce dose according to creatinine clearance.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Diarrhoea; nausea; vomiting; abdominal pain; dyspepsia; rash; urticaria; Headache; dizziness; pruritus; pseudomembranous colitis. Uncommon: angioedema. Rare: fatigue; Haemolytic anaemia; thrombocytopenia; leucopenia; interstitial nephritis; serum sickness-like reaction; Stevens–Johnson syndrome (SJS); erythema multiforme.

dosages.detailedPatientGroup: Child (6–17 years, body-weight 40 kg and above)
